lines.gurmukhi: jwq hY jgqR jYsy qIrQ jwqRw nimq mwJ hI bsq bg mihmw n jwnI hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaat Hai Jagatr Jaisay Teerad Jaatraa Namita , Maajh Hee Basat Bag Mahimaa N Jaanee Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as the whole world go to places of pilgrimage, but the egret living there has not appreciated the greatness of these places,

lines.gurmukhi: pUrn pRgws Bwskir jgmg joq aulU AMD kMD burI krnI kmwnI hY
lines.transliteration_english: Pooran Pragaas Bhaasakari Jagamag Jota , Uloo Andh Kandh Buree Karanee Kamaanee Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as bright light spreads all around when the Sun rises, but an owl has committed so many ill deeds that he remains hidden in dark caves and burrows,

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy qau bsMq smY sPl bnwspqI inhPl sYNbl bfweI aur AwnI hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Tau Basant Samai Sadhal Banaasapatee , Nihadhal Sainbal Badaaee Ur Aanee Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as all vegetation bears flowers and fruits during spring season but a cotton silk tree who has brought in him the praise of being big and mighty, remains bereft of flowers and fruits.

lines.gurmukhi: moh gur swgr mY cwiKE nhI pRym rsu qiRKwvMq cwqiRk jugq bkbwnI hY ]525]
lines.transliteration_english: Moh Gur Saagar Mai Chaakhiao Nahee Praym Rasu , Trikhaavant Chaatrik Jougat Bakabaanee Hai ?525?

Shabad OS B.translation: Despite living near the vast ocean like True Guru, I, the unfortunate one, had not tasted the divine elixir obtained by His loving worship. I have only been making noise of my thirst like a rain-bird. I have only indulged in empty arguments and contemplat
